page.title: 17DOBBS WEIR AND SURROUNDINGS
page.content: East of Hoddesdon lies an area of mixed features. There is a contrast between the more industrial area of the north and the more rural and partly residential area in the southern half. Dominating the area are the three large cooling towers of the disused power station opposite the electricity transformer station. The main Cambridge to Liverpool Street line borders the industrial area, while the River Lea or Lee meanders through the southern corner. A tow path follows the course of the river and this area is part of the Lea Valley park. At Dobbs Weir the River Lea Canal beanches off and continues southward. The river and canal provide a natural habitat for all kinds of wildlife and an attraction for recreational activities.
